result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Secora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unauthorized Use Of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Unauthorized Use Of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge  and/or restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  These amounts and all applicable fees of supervision  as a condition of Extended Supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  To be paid by the end of supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment..

***DECISION AND ORDER dated December 19, 2014/Judge Timothy Witkowiak/JOC amended to include a TOTAL of 228 days on count one and count two of sentence credit.***
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Unauthorized Use Of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.   Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Counts one and two.
Letter from girlfriend (Lindsay Manriquez).
Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing 10/16/2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Corrected JOC generated to remove wrong sentence credit from Amended JOC.
Decision and order Partially Granting Request for Additional Sentence Credit signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's supplement to request for additional credit, including a copy of the revocation order in Waukesha County case 01CF1208.
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.
Letter from defendant received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS  with 211  days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 211 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.


Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: 
Restitution in the amount of $800.00 payable to Khalid A; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jason M Secora in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jason M Secora in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Jason M Secora not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Defendant was not produced from prision.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appears before Madam Clerk Brenda, and ADA Thomas Potter appears telephonically, to request adjournment of Plea Hearing, previously scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30am, to a later date.  Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 01:30pm in Branch 22.   Hearing will be held in Room 608 of the Milwaukee County Courthouse on that date due to change of Courtroom Location only.

Attorney Mary G Guimont in court, defendant Jason M Secora not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.
-Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 3-27-2014 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Jason M Secora not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Secora in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jason M Secora in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Thomas Carr-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason M Secora in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jason M Secora in custody.  Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP from Waukesha County Jail
